Note: Participant scrolled through setup glasses menu and accurately selected the MR glasses and neural band without mistakenly clicking the Gen2 option. Normally, PTs will choose the first option without scrolling all the way through
Participant was slightly hesitant and unsure if they were selecting the correct glasses
Participant was unsure where to look for LED pulsing light and did not immediately see the blinking LED until I assisted them in locating it on the MR glasses
After successfully locating LED light, PT was able to successfully move forward with pairing process
When reading neural band pairing instructions, participant had a difficult time finding button on band
Participant is seeing MR display on glasses but continues adjusting and looking around saying the screen is not located where they would like it
Participant believes that set up instructions have been clear and helpful

Participant was unable to submit last survey question before time ran out but their answers were:

Real World/Busy Backdrop
Participant taking longer time to answer survey questions as they require reading glasses but is still able to read information with enough time to concentrate
Participant notices that hand gestures are generally responsive and says Hypertrail is helping them get the hang of them
Participant focusing gaze on brown coffee table since they say it provides a flat and solid background that does not interfere with the screen clarity
Participant notices that the ball in Hypertrail doesn’t always respond, meaning their hand gestures aren’t as sensitive as they would appreciate
Participant adjusted glasses and accidentally took a picture using the capture button
Participant adjusted glasses because they were sliding and said they felt a need to push them up
Participant is highly aware of location of screen within one lens and finds it a bit difficult to concentrate both eyes without focusing on blind spot
Participant says that the text on screen and contents displayed are legible and clear
Participant says glasses do not feel physically uncomfortable on nose bridge despite calling them bulky. Glasses slip down nose bridge but sides feel comfortable
